rComments: One of the greatest TA's to grace this earth. My grade hinged on his ability to teach the material and he stepped up to the challenge. He may love his bunny a whole lot, but ssomething tells me he loves his students even more...
SUPER ! Nice helpful.Interesting.Sense of humor. A world of experience to the class.Idealfull/ prof some day !

George was the best TA I will probobly ever have.  He is very blunt but very funny and engaging.  He knows all the topics and can guide you with any questions what so ever.  He will prepare you for the exam which none of the other TAs will help you with.

If you truly value your education, enrolling in George's section will be your best way to get an A in astro. He knows all the integral topics you need to have memorized about astronomy for the tests and more. I was skeptical of who to sign up with at first but it turned out that Ricco was the most helpful teacher i had all quarter.

It was evident from the 1st day of class that George was the best TA, and that proved to be true for the entire quarter. His review sessions are unmatched by those of the other TAs, and he also has a way of going over ALL the material you need to know while still fitting in a plethora of reference to relevant social issues. Best TA available PERIOD

George is very animated and blunt, but has passion for what he does. The only ta i know of who is available practically 24/7 via AIM, he is extremely dedicated to his students. It takes a while to get used to his personality, but his cynically realist views always make for an entertaining class at least!

George wears Hello Kitty shirts and sweats to class, enjoys talking about gangsta rap and the NWA, and has a bunny fetish. Yet somehow I consider him an Astronomy genius- he does an exceptional job teaching the material and prepared me very much for the final and midterm. I don't regret having him as my Astro TA. He knows what he's talking about.
This TA is very hit-or-miss, but he hit with me.  Don't be intimidated by him; instead, work to earn his respect, and you will end up doing really well in the class.

Amazingly demanding TA will get you to learn this material no matter how much time he has to spend with you.  Loves both covering concepts and doing problems.  Probably the best exam prep person on campus, as he knows how to prepare his students for the exams moreso than any TA I have had in my fours years at school.

I really suck at math but George was able to help me out a lot with understanding the material. He was definitely approachable outside of class and was very patient with me when he had to repeat his explanations to me. I'd say that if I didnt meet up with him, I probably would've not passed this class. George, you're awesome!

I am far from a good math student, the terror number bring to me is crippling. George did his best to be available to me and make the not so complex math understnadable. Without such decent help my B- would have been much lower. I actually felt willing to try at my homework, and not get too frusterated with the material.

George maintains rigid standards in order to bolster the performance of his students. He offers limitless assistance in order to ensure that one will be capable of meeting these expectations. George is perfectly reasonable, and truly acts in the best interests of the students, for, if they exert the effort, he will greatly help them achieve.

George Ricco is a genius but crazy. Go to his section. do your homework prior to class. ask as many questions as possible. he'll give you very similiar material thats on the final. Class is a waste but interesting. you should get at least a B.its that simple. he will teach u life lessons and give you answers from the great beyond...REM anyone?

George goes out of his way to make himself available to students by giving out his phone number and creating an AIM name just to help out ASTR2 students.  He is the only TA I have ever had at UCSC who has held review sections offcampus at reasonable times.  He expects his students to do well and that motivated me to give the class the time of day.

Made an otherwise good class a complete waste of time with his senseless drivel and inability to stay on-topic. I really have no interest in hearing about your day to day life or pointless stories when I'm paying hard earned money to work towards a degree. I'm here to learn, not to humor you. GTFO.
George is an awesome TA, you just have to be willing to get to know him.  He's got a little of the ADD, so it seems like he's all over the place, but he's also brilliant and really helpful.

One of the worst instructors I've ever encountered. Intimidating, unhelpful, condescending, egotistic, insulting, and all-around detrimental. Rather than review the material (supposedly his job!) he bored the group with anecdotes, injokes, and off-topic ramblings, then berated us for our ignorance of the topic.

He was an intimidating TA, and never answered a question before insulting the person who asked it.  He was unclear, and often seemed like he didn't know the course material, but wasn't willing to admit it.  On the other hand, he had high expectations for his students, which was motivation to work hard.  All in all, I wish I could have switched TAs.
